intro: Sebschauera oblongata, commonly known as the oblong leaf sebschauera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, oval-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
